casual adjective
(INFORMAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 Casual clothes are not formal or not suitable for special occasions: He was dressed in casual clothes--sneakers, blue jeans, and a t-shirt.
More examplesFewer examplesHis casual behaviour was wholly inappropriate for such a formal occasion.His clothes were artfully arranged to look stylishly casual.Everyone else was in jeans and casual gear and I had my office clothes on - I stuck out like a sore thumb.
